home.title:
Vanhuffel
Bart
home.intro: Hey! I’m Bart, a programmer focused on full-stack development. I like clean interfaces, tidy code, and projects that feel truly finished. Outside of coding, you’ll usually find me hanging out with friends, listening to music, working out, or gaming.

hobbies.title: Hobbies
hobbies.lead: Two things that always recharge me: gaming and fitness.

gaming.title: Gaming
gaming.lead: Gaming is a long-time hobby for me. I play on PC, PlayStation, and Switch, and I especially enjoy fantasy and story-driven games you can really get lost in.
gaming.whyBody: I get into gaming through my stepfather, and once I get my hands on a controller as a kid, it sticks. For me it’s relaxation, inspiration, and sometimes simply escaping into another world.

fitness.title: Fitness
fitness.lead: Fitness is my straightforward way to stay healthy: get stronger, build energy, and keep my mind sharp. It feels great to see progress, even in small steps.
fitness.whyBody: I start because a friend invites me, and it becomes something that helps me stay disciplined and balanced. I have on-and-off periods, but living close to a gym makes it much easier to train consistently.

education.title:
Programming
Associate Degree
education.body: I study programming because I enjoy building digital products. I explore different jobs, but I keep coming back to computers and technology. Software development feels like the perfect mix of creativity and problem-solving.

portfolio.title: Portfolio
portfolio.lead: A selection of projects I’m proud of, highlighting what I learned.

gleenie.name: Gleenie.org
gleenie.description: Gleenie.org is a durable programming project built in Laravel with a Tailwind frontend. It’s a major frontend learning opportunity where I work with UI blocks and implement directly from a design document.

ict21.name: ICT21
ict21.description: ICT21 is a Laravel-based project with a CMS system in the backend. Implementing it requires a strong understanding of Filament resources. I also work with Livewire for the contact form, which adds valuable hands-on experience.

gogomon.name: Gogomon
gogomon.description: Gogomon is a fitness mobile and smartwatch app I build as part of a team. We plan the database and API, research platforms, and build primarily in .NET MAUI. We also ship a Wear OS version and actively work with GDPR considerations.

deckbuilder.name: Deckbuilder
deckbuilder.description: Deckbuilder is an MVC web app I use to learn REST APIs. I work with request and result models and deepen my understanding of loose coupling. The app also gives me hands-on experience with sessions and JWT tokens.

skills.title: Skillset
skills.lead: An overview of technologies and concepts I actively work with or build experience in.

primary.title: Primary stack
primary.description: Technologies I work with most and confidently use in real projects.

secondary.title: Secondary experience
secondary.description: Technologies I actively use but that are not part of my daily stack.

concepts.title: Concepts & practices
concepts.description: Fundamental concepts that appear throughout my projects and way of working.

learning.title: Currently learning
learning.description: Topics I actively explore and improve on.
